{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34440].
  {panel}

Repro Steps:
1. Go to https://www.modern.ie and download a VM with Win7 IE 11, get it running etc
2. Confirm IE11 version is 11.0.9600.16428, Update Version: RTM
3. Log into confluence (EAC, PUG, jira-dev, etc)
4. Create a personal space
5. Create a page (meeting note blueprint)
6. Boom, crash goes the browser

Workarounds:
- Apply operating system updates
- or, disable the confluence-paste plugin

Notes:
- This appears to be caused by a bug in IE11 with mutationobserver, https://connect.microsoft.com/IE/feedback/details/809376/ie11-crash-when-using-insertadjacenthtml-on-a-tbody-with-a-mutationobserver-installed
- This patch appears to fix it, https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/security/ms14-010.aspx

*Reporter*: Rob Sangster
*E-mail*: [mailto:rsangster@atlassian.com]
fields.summary: Create page crashes on unpatched IE11 RTM

fields.description:
Hi guys.
We have found that In IE10, deleting dot points across multiple tab levels can cause the browser to crash.

Given the attached example, at least 3 behaviours can be demonstrated by making the following selections(including all text on the line) and then pressing delete:
* Dot Point 5.1 to 5.4, this will remove the items. Leaving an empty dot point at the same tab level.
* Dot Point 5.1 to 6, this will NOT remove the items and the cursor will move to the start of the Dot Point 6.1 text.
* Dot Point 5.1 to 6.1 (or even 6.2), the items will remain highlighted and the browser will "crash"
* Dot Points 5.1 to 7, this will NOT remove the items and the cursor will move to the start of the Dot Point 7.1 text

I have attached a video of the above scenarios which was recorded on 5.1 but has been replicated on 5.5.3 using the SDK.

Cheers
Mark.
fields.summary: Deleting dot points can cause IE10 to crash

fields.description:
When creating a new page in confluence, the amount of content is limited by the number of users (i.e. if you have too many users for your license you can't create new pages). This business case makes sense, however the point at which the check happens is flawed.

The expected behaviour is when clicking the "Create" button, the dialog display a warning message or error, preventing you from initiating the edit/create cycle.

The current behavior is that you are allowed to begin the edit/creation process, and only after clicking the "Save" button, do you see the following error:

http://monosnap.com/image/Hk0MhsYmJZhl0NXdzgV3FKMAHeaRJA

The resulting impact is that all the work you just tried to create has been lost. Although clicking "back" in some browsers will let you recover the content, since this is a licensing issue, it's unlikely that the root problem can be solved before a full session time out occurs.

The ideal solution would be to add a usage check earlier in the workflow. Keeping the current check is protection against race conditions, however is not sufficient on its own for a good user experience.
fields.summary: Rate Limits on Page Creation Happen At the Wrong Point

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34397].
  {panel}

h4.Scenario A (single user restriction, single page):
Create a page without any child pages, and monitor the index queue. Add a view restriction to a single user, and notice that the index queue now has *3 entries added*

h4.Scenario B (multiple user restriction, single page):
Create a page without any child pages, and monitor the index queue. Add 2 view restrictions to 2 separate users, and notice that the index queue now has *6 entries added*

h4.Scenario C (multiple user restriction, page with 1 child):
Create a page, and add a child page, and monitor the index queue. Add 2 view restrictions to 2 separate users (to the parent page), and notice that the index queue now has *12 entries added*

h4.Scenario D (single group restriction, page with 1 child):
Create a page, and add a child page, and monitor the index queue. Add 1 view restriction to 1 group (to the parent page), and notice that the index queue now has *6 entries added*

Notice from the scenarios above that the index queue is doubled, if you add a similar restriction to another user, on the same page, and that this effect is *compounded with every child page*. This is compounded for every attachment as well. 

This is a serious performance impact on many large instances, especially when they are affected by this: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-16866 . Some instances' queue entries may grow to a really large number in a very short time, resulting in outages, as the index cannot be cleared with subsequent flushes.

h3.Workaround
Utilize Scenario D. Add the individual users you wish to restrict individually into a group instead, and restrict the pages to a group.
fields.summary: Combine Multiple Individual User Restrictions In 1 Index Queue Entry

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34386].
  {panel}

As we know, according to [this feature request|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-2085] we cannot change Space Keys in Confluence yet. 

However, when we create a Personal Space, it will retrieve the space key according to the username. Instead of that, this feature request is to update the personal space key automatically (or through a re-index) according to the new username change. For example:

# Create a Personal Space for user gdecampos (retrieving the key gdecampos)
# Change the username to giuliano
# The Space Key will not change
fields.summary: Update Personal space key when Updating the username

h3. Summary
Images in tables that are not manually sized increase in size or are missing when exported to PDF.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a table in a Confluence Page
# Insert an image in one of the cells
# Export page to PDF

h3. Expected Results
The exported PDF matches what is displayed in the page when viewed

h3. Actual Results
The small image is displayed much larger than its actual size or the image is missing in the table.

h3. Workaround
# Edit page with the image
# Click on image, resize to any size *use the _px_ value* . i.e. :
!Screen Shot 2015-04-17 at 3.03.42 AM.png|thumbnail!
# Press enter to apply the change to the image
# Click on image again, resize back to the desired size i.e. :
!Screen Shot 2015-04-17 at 3.03.59 AM.png|thumbnail!
# Press enter to apply the change and save page
# Export page to PDF
fields.summary: Embedded images placed inside of a table are not displaying properly when page is exported to PDF

fields.description:
While importing a particular word document into Confluence we faced repetitively a severe confluence server crash down, meaning that it is not operational and reachable anymore! We managed to isolate the content in the word document that produces the severe malfunction to be a particular image. Copying this image from a .docx file to a .doc file will produce the same error. However, modifying the bit pattern of this image slighty (e.g., by switching to another compression level) will solve the problem. Of course, this is a very unpleasant situation because if anybody tries to import another word document (with comparable "features") our server will crash down and the current work of many other users might be lost. Because we are seriously considering to upgrade our starter license to a 500 user license, this issue needs definitely to be solved in advance.

In parallel, due to the priority level we have already submitted a support request under the same summary.

Thank you very much in advance for a fast solution!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Confluence 5.5.2, create a page and go to Tools > Import Word Doc
# Import [Testfall.docx|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/123825/Testfall.docx], leaving all options as default
# Observe that the Confluence process is terminated. 
# This is all that appears in the logs:
{code}
2014-08-18 12:51:24,510 WARN [http-bio-10552-exec-7] [atlassian.confluence.cache.TransactionalCacheFactory] warning Transactional cache update outside transaction. All updates to this cache should be performed from a thread with a valid transaction context.
 -- referer: http://localhost:10552/confluence/pages/worddav/uploadimport.action?pageId=950274 | url: /confluence/rest/stp/1.0/license/status | userName: admin
2014-08-18 12:51:30,781 WARN [http-bio-10552-exec-9] [com.benryan.webwork.WordImportAction] executeFileUpload Failed to delete uploaded file /home/denise/confluence/home/552home/temp/upload_bdfcea9b_ccf0_4f35_a28f_2e94ad861811_00000001.tmp
 -- url: /confluence/pages/worddav/importword.action | page: 950274 | userName: admin | referer: http://localhost:10552/confluence/pages/worddav/uploadimport.action?pageId=950274 | action: importword
2014-08-18 12:51:31,276 WARN [http-bio-10552-exec-5] [atlassian.confluence.cache.TransactionalCacheFactory] warning Transactional cache update outside transaction. All updates to this cache should be performed from a thread with a valid transaction context.
 -- referer: http://localhost:10552/confluence/pages/worddav/importword.action | url: /confluence/rest/stp/1.0/license/status | userName: admin
{code}
# Running {{strace}} on the process shows that it is killed by a seg fault:
{code}
Process 4901 attached
futex(0x7fe36b4269d0, FUTEX_WAIT, 4905, NULL <unfinished ...>
+++ killed by SIGSEGV (core dumped) +++
{code}

h3. Workaround
Save the image in another format and use that instead. I used .bmp for the attached [testfall-working.doc|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/125444/testfall-working.doc], which imports successfully.

{panel:borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA|Title=Update}
If you regularly experience this problem, and are running Confluence 5.9.1 or later, see [JVM crashes during Import from Word|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/JVM+crashes+during+Import+from+Word+in+Confluence] knowledge base article for details of a workaround. 
{panel}
fields.summary: Severe Confluence Server Crash Down On Word Document Import

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34369].
  {panel}

Often when drafting up a page I will start with a list of items, and then realise that I need extra information for each point, such as assignee, notes, relevant material etc. The conversion process is currently manual and tedious. It would be great to be able to either:
* Copy paste a list into a table and have it divide into rows, or
* Have a tool that you pass a list into which outputs a table

Bonus points for dividing into columns based on common delimiters!

fields.description:
Currently when you select MySQL from the drop down for external databases on the Database Configuration Screen of the Confluence Setup Wizard you get a yellow highlighted warning box that states: 

{quote}Confluence needs a MySQL driver. Please consult our documentation for more information.{quote}

The wording can be confusing when paired with a warning box, and lead one to believe the plugin isn't installed when all that needs to happen is click the External Database button. 

I have two suggestions that might alleviate confusion:
# Change the wording to be more obvious that it is a reminder and not a warning that something is wrong
# Base the appearance of this warning box on whether the driver is loaded by Confluence (which it should do at startup if the driver is installed correctly)
fields.summary: Warning for MySQL driver on Database Configuration Screen can cause confusion

See attached screen for sprint field value selected by macro.
fields.summary: JIRA Issue Macro displays the incorrect Sprint value

fields.description:
We've been receiving several user reports in our environment that when page names are being updated, the links are breaking in Gliffy diagrams. We received the below response initially after reporting this issue to Gliffy. However, we found that Confluence links are in fact persistent and not static, links do not break when pages are renamed. Can you please help us resolve this issue either through Atlassian support or by escalating the issue with Gliffy?

Katy Kelly, Jul 22 11:03 AM:
Hi Jason,
The Plugins team reviewed this again and unfortunately this is Confluence's behavior. Gliffy is not able to change the way this acts unless Confluence also changes the behavior.
We apologize that we are not able to correct this. If Atlassian indicates there is something we are able to change, we would be happy to do so but all our information from them has indicated this is the way it currently behaves.
Thank you, 
Katy
support@gliffy.com
fields.summary: Links break if destination Confluence page is renamed (Gliffy)

1. Open any page in editor
2. Click anywhere inside existing text
3. Select any part of text using Shift+RightArrow

fields.summary: Editor: Caret moves unexpectedly to the beginning of selected text

fields.description:
Newlines before and after every macro using different browsers is not standardize. See attachment sample of a page using a table macro and code block macro created using Google Chrome browser.

!img1.PNG|thumbnail!

*1. Edit page using Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox 30 browsers*

When you edit the page using Google Chrome browser, the newline and spacing between macros looks expected in {{img4.png}}

!img4.png|thumbnail!

In Chrome, you can redirect your word cursor before and after the macros in the same line. In Firefox 30 however, you cannot.

*2. Edit page using IE9 browsers*

When you edit the page using IE9 browser, the newlines between macros will have two newlines instead of one in {{img2.PNG}}

!img2.png|thumbnail!

*3. Edit page using IE10, Mozilla Firefox 27 browsers*

When you edit the page using IE10 browser, the newlines between macros will have one newline as expected, but there is an additional space after each newline as shown in {{img3.PNG}}. Same results appear in Firefox 27.

!img3.PNG|thumbnail!

Depending on which browser was last used to save the page, the affected new lines will have either additional newline of new space.

It should be standardize for all browsers so that there will not be any unintended newlines before and after each new macros.
fields.summary: Newlines between Macros in Page Editor not Standardize using Different Browsers

fields.description:
h3. Summary:

Confluence connected with JIRA as user management, once you set-up the directory, you'll see that those users will show up there, even though they doesn't have *Can Use permission* nor *belong to confluence-users* group.

h3. Our documentation:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Searching+the+People+Directory

{quote}
The people directory displays a list of people who are authorised to log in to your Confluence site.

The people directory includes anybody who has logged into Confluence or who has had a user account created for them in Confluence.

The people directory does not include users who can log into Confluence using external user management if they have never yet logged in.
{quote}

h3. Steps to reproduce:

# Have a test user, that belongs only to jira-user group.
# Create a JIRA User server in JIRA.
# Connect with Confluence.
# After connect JIRA to Confluence as user management, check the people directory.
# You'll see that the test user is there, and it doesn't have access to Confluence.
fields.summary: People Directory shows users that doesn't have access Confluence.

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34338].
  {panel}

Instructional text in a global page template marked with user mention feature does not work with various browsers (Chrome 36, Firefox 31, IE 11 all on Windows 7. Works as a charm with Safari on OSX).

How to repeat:
1. Create a template
2. Create an instructional text like "Type @ to add a user mention"
3. Mark instructional text as "User mention"
4. Save template an create a new page using the template
5. Click on the instructional text and type @

Result: The user mention dialog opens but will never find a result as the complete instructional text is used as search string for a user name. The cursor is set AFTER the instructional text. On IE 11 the mention works BUT the user name is displayed at the top of the page no matter where the instructional text is positioned on the page.

This is also true for typing [ when searching for a page on a "standard" instructional text.

This makes it impossible for us to use instructional text for user guidance.
fields.summary: User Mention feature of Instructional Text Macro does not work with various browsers

fields.description:
When trying to use Find and Replace to search for text modified by markup inside the Confluence editor, multiple browsers have issues searching. This bug affects Chrome (tested on 36.0.1985.125) and Firefox (tested on 30.0). I have tested this in 5.0.3 and 5.5.3.

h3. Reproduction steps
# Create a new page
# Paste the following into the page
{code}h3. Link
This is a [link|#Link].{code}
# Save the page
# Open the page for editing
# Bring up Find and Replace (CMD+F or Ctrl+F)
# Type 'a link' into the search field and press Enter

h3. Expected behavior
After hitting enter, the editor would highlight the text if it exists. This behavior does work properly in Safari 7.0.5 (9537.77.4) and Internet Explorer 11.0.9600.17207.

h3. Actual behavior
h4. Firefox
After pressing Enter once it appears that nothing happens, no text is highlighted. If you continue to press Enter, the cursor will move into the main editor windows and new lines will be placed into the top of the document.

h4. Chrome
After pressing Enter it appears that nothing happens, no text is highlighted. You can press Enter as many times as you would like, it never highlights text, but the editor does not have any other abnormal behavior.

h3. Related Notes
* This does not affect Safari. Following the steps listed above *will* highlight the appropriate text.
* In my testing this did not affect IE 11. Following the steps listed above *did* highlight the appropriate text.
* This only affects text modified by markup. If you use the buttons in the editor to create the h3 and the link search will work.
fields.summary: Find and Replace in Editor issues when using markup

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34326].
  {panel}

I have recently started migrating our content from using the [Metadata plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/org.andya.confluence.plugins.metadata] to the Page Properties macro. I am doing this because the Metadata plugin seems to be no longer fully supported and does not have rich text support.

We collect the data from page properties macros into a single page using the page properties report in the same way we used to with the Metadata-list and Metadata-report macros. We edit the page and replace the existing metadata-list macro with the Page Properties macro.

This has resulted in extremely slow load speeds for the pages using the page properties report macro.

|| Page  ||  Load speed ||
| Page with "Page Properties Report" macro | ~38 seconds |
| Page without "Page Properties Report" macro | ~1 second |

For the example above: There are 780 pages in the space. No restricted pages in the space. I am asking the report to show only properties of pages with a single label.

I suspect there is a conflict between the Metadata plugin and the Page Prroperties macro.
fields.summary: Slow load speed for page using Page Properties Macro report

fields.description:
When moving a page in confluence 5.5.2 the task gets duplicated.

Create a dashboard as follows:
Dashboard ->  Myspace -> child-Myspace
Edit Myspace and add three tasks
Move the page to child-Myspace
Now you will have 6 tasks.  Three additional ones that are identical to the original three.
fields.summary: Task items are duplicated when moving the page in comfluence 5.5.2

fields.description:
If you report pages using the {content by label} macro IE8 displays scroll bars for each entry. (see Screenshot)

!CF_bug.PNG!

regarding: CF5.5.2 on premise

Quite a few of our customers are still using the older IE (like 8 or 9)
Please don't stop supporting them, yet. Even the large companies don't have a choice to update to later version and these kind of bugs sind just frustrating, since we promise, that IE8 is still supported. (ref. to https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Supported+Platforms)
fields.summary: IE8/9 displays scroll bars in {content by label} macro entries

h3. Workaround
There are no adverse effects of this issue, because it relates to an unused function in Notifications that is due to be removed in a future release. However, the error can be stopped:
# Log in to Confluence Admin > Manage Add-ons
# Expand the *Atlassian Notifications SPI Plugin*
# Disable the module *Flag to show prompt to users to update notification settings*

h3. Resolution
Upgrade to Confluence 5.6 or above.
